cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 180 mi SSW of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north, then turning northeast to cross the Florida Panhandle and the southeastern United States before emerging off the Mid-Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near Panama City / Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is in effect from South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC (does not yet include Delaware).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from north of Fernandina Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC; Hurricane Warning Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River, FL.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast through Georgia and the Carolinas, then the Mid-Atlantic coastline including Delaware and southern New Jersey.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; peak sustained winds generally 25–35 mph with isolated gusts to near tropical-storm force Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (around 1–2 ft) possible along Delaware Bay and the tidal portion of the Christina River during Friday high tide cycles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain expected Friday into early Saturday with locally higher amounts, enough for ponding and minor flooding in low-lying areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief marine squalls and very rough seas on Delaware Bay Friday; operations for vessels at anchor or alongside may be limited.
